title: Add send and receive buttons to the Receive tab

requirements.text: In the TransferHistory component (frontend/src/components/TransferHistory.tsx), add two prominent action buttons labeled 'Send Files' and 'Receive Files' at the top of the Received tab content area, above the ReceivedDownloadsList component
acceptanceCriteria: Two buttons are displayed at the top of the Received tab
Buttons are labeled 'Send Files' and 'Receive Files'
Buttons are touch-friendly (minimum 44x44px) and visually distinct
Buttons maintain the mobile-optimized design language of the app

requirements.text: Wire the 'Send Files' button click handler to switch the active Dashboard tab to 'transfer', programmatically navigating the user to the file transfer interface
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking 'Send Files' navigates to the Transfer tab in the Dashboard
Navigation uses the existing tab switching mechanism (URL hash or state management)
Haptic feedback is triggered on button tap

requirements.text: Wire the 'Receive Files' button click handler to open the QR scanner modal (QRScannerModal component), allowing users to scan QR codes to receive files
acceptanceCriteria: Modal uses the device camera to scan QR codes
Haptic feedback is triggered on button tap
Successful QR scan follows the existing session-based file receive workflow

constraints: Do not modify the existing ReceivedDownloadsList component functionality
Maintain consistency with the mobile-first design patterns used throughout the app
Use existing QR scanner modal and tab navigation mechanisms
nonGoals: Adding send/receive buttons to other tabs
Changing the existing file download or transfer workflows
Modifying the QR code scanning implementation
